data.text: @Welshbeard I shall endeavor to make that happen, thank you for your thoughtful advice x

@godnojoe That is a coping mechanism. Hopefully, when your mood is more stable, and uplifted, you can consider what causes you to feel this way, and maybe consider ways of addressing/improving the situation.
@Welshbeard My strategy is usually to distract myself with other exciting/fun things, do we call that coping mechanism?
@godnojoe I'm sorry to read that you're a little down at the moment. Do you have some strategies of dealing with it?
Relationships of not just the kind with me and my bfs present and past, but also that of with my parents. These are hard to process because I’ve never been very good at any of them.

Current bout of depression might had also come from watching this movie last night. I cried on and off through it, and there was some discussion with the bf about the way it ended. It prompted me to think about my relationships too, and that’s always sad. https://t.co/XNOJh5zrKQ
